comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.body: The Internet will not kill me with laughter...lol. People are just coming up with their information as it comes to their heads. This tweet might mean nothing to me because who does not know that Bitcoin has been active 100% since many years ago? And what happened to 2010 and 2013?All these would have made more meaning if the tweep could back it up with technical explanations, but none was attached. Transactions are always actively going on with the BTC blockchain, and no bank or payment system in the whole world could compete with it.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: To be honest, as best way to see Bitcoin growth in value and price (value is reflected on market by market price) is looking at Bitcoin Min price of each year.Rather than looking at tops, all time highs which are more sensitive to hypes, greed as well as market forced liquidations, Min Yearly Prices more correctly show Bitcoin growth.Yearly candlesAnother way is looking at Bitcoin price in bear markets. I am sure you can see solid upwards trends since 2014, 2018 and 2022 bear markets. I played with it some time in 2021.Fact sheet for bitcoin price (daily low, high, close price over years)

comments.body: So, this is uptime. Those that will just look at the percentage and numbers might think that it's quite funny and think it's all about the price. But anyway, is there a point in time when bitcoin's network has been interrupted? The only thing that I can remember when transactions were too slow and crazily high was during the 2017 high but even though, bitcoin was still up at that time and wasn't interrupted at all.
